title: Authors and Citation
text: Ekholm E (2024). blueycolors: Provides Bluey Inspired Color Palettes. R package version 0.0.1.0,  https://ekholme.github.io/blueycolors/, https://github.com/ekholme/blueycolors.
code: @Manual{,   title = {blueycolors: Provides Bluey Inspired Color Palettes},   author = {Eric Ekholm},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1.0,  https://ekholme.github.io/blueycolors/},   url = {https://github.com/ekholme/blueycolors}, }

title: Provides Bluey Inspired Color Palettes
text: blueycolors provides color palettes ggplot2 color fill scales inspired Bluey

title: Provides Bluey Inspired Color Palettes
text: probably 2 main uses package: Extracting palettes associated hex codes Using palettes color fill aesthetics ggplot extract palettes & hex codes, use bluey_palette() function: use palettes ggplot, use scale_color_bluey() scale_fill_bluey() discrete scales scale_color_bluey_c() scale_fill_bluey_c() continuous scales.   currently 4 different palettes available, “heeler” option probably provides best contrast.
code: library(blueycolors)  bluey_palette("bluey") #> [1] "#d2ebff" "#88cafc" "#404066" "#2b2c41" "#edcc6f" library(ggplot2)  tmp <- data.frame(   x = rnorm(100),   y = rnorm(100),   z = rep(c("a", "b", "c", "d"), 25) )  ggplot(tmp, aes(x = x, y = y, color = z)) +   geom_point() +   scale_color_bluey() tmp2 <- data.frame(   x = 1:5,   y = c("a", "b", "c", "d", "e") )   ggplot(tmp2, aes(x = x, y = y, fill = y)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_bluey(option = "socks")

title: Available Bluey Color Palettes — bluey_colors
text: Use bluey_palette extract palettes desired length

title: Bluey ggplot 2 color scales — bluey_ggplot2_scales
text: ggplot2 fill color scales derived Bluey characters scale_color_bluey() scale_fill_bluey() provide discrete fill functions scale_color_bluey_c() scale_fill_bluey_c() provide continuous fill functions`

title: Bluey ggplot 2 color scales — bluey_ggplot2_scales
code: scale_color_bluey(option = "bluey", direction = 1, ...)  scale_fill_bluey(option = "bluey", direction = 1, ...)  scale_color_bluey_c(option = "bluey", direction = 1, ...)  scale_fill_bluey_c(option = "bluey", direction = 1, ...)

title: Bluey ggplot 2 color scales — bluey_ggplot2_scales
text: option name color palette use. See bluey_palette available options direction greater equal 0, return standard direction; otherwise reverse direction palette ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2 scale functions

title: Bluey ggplot 2 color scales — bluey_ggplot2_scales
code: library(ggplot2) tmp <- data.frame(x = rnorm(100), y = rnorm(100), z = rep(c("a", "b", "c", "d"), 25))  # using a discrete scale ggplot(tmp, aes(x, y, color = z)) + geom_point() + scale_color_bluey()   # changing the palette used when creating a discrete scale ggplot(tmp, aes(x, y, color = z)) + geom_point() + scale_color_bluey(option = "socks")

title: Bluey Color Palette Constructor — bluey_palette
text: option name color palette use. Current options 'bluey', 'chilli', 'heeler', 'socks' n number colors return. Currently, scales limited 5 colors
